arts.ttl: World media reacts as 'lucky' Scotland survive Athens 'cat and mouse' game while Greece go all in on penalty fury
arts.sum: It was another impressive away win for Scotland as Scott McTominay's penalty sealed an away win over Greece

arts.ttl: John Souttar hails 2 Scotland teammates for braving 'the toughest thing in football' to inspire heroic Greece win
arts.sum: Souttar was thoroughly impressed with Anthony Ralston and Grant Hanley who came out of cold storage in Athens

arts.ttl: Scotland do 'dirty side' but Greece tie 'not dead'
arts.sum: Scotland showed "a different side" to their game as they beat Greece in the first leg of their Nations League A play-off, according to head coach Steve Clarke.

arts.ttl: 'Scotland's great survivor Hanley basks in battle'
arts.sum: Grant Hanley has been written off, left out and cast aside. But the 33-year-old was there again when Scotland needed him, writes Tom English.

arts.ttl: I don’t see the game as being closed at all – Scotland boss Steve Clarke
arts.sum: Scott McTominay’s penalty separated Scotland and Greece in the first leg of their Nations League play-off.

arts.ttl: 'Two VAR decisions went in our favour' - Clarke on Scotland win
arts.sum: Scotland head coach Steve Clarke praises his side for their resilience in their Nations League play-off win in Greece.

arts.ttl: 'Scotland rode luck, but there's many ways to win game'
arts.sum: Richard Gordon and the team look back on Greece 0-1 Scotland in the Nations League

arts.ttl: 'Kenny says he's still the main man' - Robertson on Scotland cap target
arts.sum: Captain Andy Robertson will become Scotland's third-highest ever men's cap holder if he plays against Greece on Thursday.

arts.ttl: Watch best of action as Scotland win in Greece
arts.sum: Watch highlights as Scotland win in Greece in the first leg of their Nations League play-off.

arts.ttl: 'Picky' Steve Clarke wants more Scotland BRAVERY as boss warns his troops 'this isn't dead yet'
arts.sum: Clarke was happy with the performance but wants his team to be more brave and clinical on Sunday
